ResourceHeader.ResourceName: VENUS EXPRESS: ASPERA-4 IMA Ion Mass Analyzer Science Data (CDF)
ResourceHeader.Description: This data set contains Particles (counts/accumulation) counted in the current azimuth, mass, energy and polar angle sector. Within the azimuth mass energy polar-angle matrix, particle counts are displayed as acquired with the first index varying fastest and depends on the operational mode.
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: Please acknowledge the Principal Investigator(s) as well as the ESA Planetary Science Archive and the CDPP (Centre des Données de la Physique des Plasmas) when making a publication using the data you are going to download. Principal Investigator(s): S. Barabash (IRF, Kiruna, Sweden)

Parameter.Name: Synchronization words for new Experiment
Parameter.Description: The 3 bytes 0xE3 0x31 0xCA mark the start of anew Experiment Data Format. A search for this is required as the EDF s floats in the TM data stream.

Parameter.Name: Experiment unit
Parameter.Description: This parameter defines the experiment unit.The field takes one of the following values: 0 (undefined) 1 (ICA) 2 (IMA MEX) 3 (IMA VEX).

Parameter.Name: Reduction Mode Index
Parameter.Description: This is the data reduction mode index used for the data in this EDF. The field takes one of the following values: 0, 2, 4, 5, or any values included in the range 8 to 35.

Parameter.Name: Experiment Data Format Counter
Parameter.Description: This is an running counter incremented by 1 for each released EDF. It swaps over to 0 after 255.

Parameter.Name: Number of sets in minimun mode
Parameter.Description: This parameter gives the number of sets in this EDF for the minimum modes.

Parameter.Name: Checksum 1 failure
Parameter.Description: This flag will set if the checksum 1 fails during RAM booting. Sets from both PROM and EEPROM booting

Parameter.Name: Checksum 0 failure
Parameter.Description: This flag will set if the checksum 0 fails during RAM booting. Sets from both PROM and EEPROM booting

Parameter.Name: Tm Fifo Emptied
Parameter.Description: This bit will set if the TM FIFO is emptied before the start of this EDF. Always forced to and from special EDF s.

Parameter.Name: HV ramping in progress
Parameter.Description: This flag will set if HV ramping has been performed during the data taking for this EDF.

Parameter.Name: Test Pattern
Parameter.Description: For testing purposes a number of imager test patterns can be commanded. This parameter gives the actual test pattern number used. Ensure it is 0 for real scientific data.

Parameter.Name: Post acceleration level
Parameter.Description: This flag gives the post acceleration level used for this format. The field takes one of the following values: 0 = Low 1 = High

Parameter.Name: Post acceleration mode
Parameter.Description: This flag indicates the post acceleration mode. If set (1) it is alternating else it is fixed.

Parameter.Name: Post-acceleration high level reference value
Parameter.Description: This parameter gives the post-acceleration high level reference value. It is retrieved from the accompanied PAHLR.asc file in the time range where applicable, if not it is set by default to 6.0. The post-acceleration index can be any value between 0 to 7. But calibration information exists only for post-acceleration index = 0, 3, 6. The calibrated values are: 0 : 39 Volts 3 : 1902 Volts 6 : 3615 Volts

Parameter.Name: Automatic Data Reduction Switch
Parameter.Description: This flag indicates whether automatic data reduction change is enabled or not. 0 = Disabled 1 = Enabled

Parameter.Name: Data compression flag
Parameter.Description: This flag indicates whether data compression is enabled or not. 0 = Disabled 1 = Enabled

Parameter.Name: Number of link packets
Parameter.Description: This gives the approximate number of 1355 link packets in the TM FIFO. To convert to words, unpack the F8 code and multiply by 3.

Parameter.Name: Program Code in RAM
Parameter.Description: This parameter gives the program code currently loaded and running in RAM. It is coded as: 0 = PROM 1-16 = EEPROM section 0-15

Parameter.Name: Sample Processing Overrun flag
Parameter.Description: This flag is set if a process overruns, i.e. the current data processing is not finished when a new is requested.

Parameter.Name: Sweep Processing Overrun flag
Parameter.Description: This flag is set if a process overruns, i.e. the current data processing is not finished when a new is requested.

Parameter.Name: Post Processing Overrun flag
Parameter.Description: This flag is set if a process overruns, i.e. the current data processing is not finished when a new is requested.

Parameter.Name: Energy start index
Parameter.Description: This parameter gives the energy start index when in the 32 level energy mode.

Parameter.Name: Reset Error flag
Parameter.Description: This flag will set if the experiment has rebooted due to watchdog or machine error reset.

Parameter.Name: Format start time
Parameter.Description: This parameter is the starting time of the EDF. Note that more significant bits must be taken from the ESA packet time. Some attention should be paid close in time when this 3 bytes counter swaps around. That happens at about once per 6 days.

Parameter.Name: Format length
Parameter.Description: This parameter gives the total length of the format (EDF) in words.

Parameter.Name: Shadow masking switch flag
Parameter.Description: This flag indicates if imager data is masked (set to zero) or not for angles that are regarded as obscured by other S/C items. 0 = Disabled 1 = Enabled.

Parameter.Name: HV Masking Switch flag
Parameter.Description: This bit indicates if imager data is masked (set to zero) or not for angles/energies that can not be reached due to insufficient or too inaccurate HV. 0 = Disabled 1 = Enabled.

Parameter.Name: Decompression error flag
Parameter.Description: Error during data decompression process If this parameter is not equal to 0, the data decompression process is invalid.

Parameter.Name: Mission phase
Parameter.Description: The CRUISE sub-phase corresponds to data collected before the VOI (VENUS Orbit Injection), including the Near Earth Verification (NEV) and Interplanetary Cruise (IC) sub-phases. After the VOI, the nominal mission is divided into different VENUS mission sub-phases defined by the VENUS EXPRESS mission planning.

Parameter.Name: Orbit number
Parameter.Description: Orbit number

Parameter.Name: Orbital Eccentricity
Parameter.Description: Orbital Eccentricity

Parameter.Name: Orbital Inclination
Parameter.Description: Orbital Inclination

Parameter.Name: Orbital Semimajor Axis
Parameter.Description: Orbital Semimajor Axis

Parameter.Name: Periapsis Altitude
Parameter.Description: Periapsis Altitude

Parameter.Name: Periapsis Argument Angle
Parameter.Description: Periapsis Argument Angle

Parameter.Name: Periapsis Time in milliseconds
Parameter.Description: Periapsis Time in milliseconds. The time of periapsis passage is the time when the satellite reaches periapsis. Time base: J2000 Time scale: Terrestrial Time

Parameter.Name: Spacecraft Orientation
Parameter.Description: The SPACECRAFT_ORIENTATION element defines the Venus Express direction of flight with respect to its spacecraft reference frame. The direction of flight is given as a 3-tuple (x,y,z). The paragraph below describes how to derive the (x,y,z) values. When the spacecraft is in nadir pointing mode, the +Z axis points towards the centre of Venus and the +X axis is perpendicular to the ground track. Unlike Mars Express, the speed vector of the spacecraft can be tilted from the +Y axis direction at an angle a. The 3-tuple (x, y, z) defines the coordinates of the normalised spacecraft speed vector. As a consequence, we have: x = sin a y = cos a

Parameter.Name: VEX ASPERA4/IMA Azimuth
Parameter.Description: VEX ASPERA4/IMA azimuth table

Parameter.Name: VEX ASPERA4/IMA Mass
Parameter.Description: VEX ASPERA4/IMA Mass table

Parameter.Name: VEX ASPERA4/IMA Ion Energy
Parameter.Description: VEX ASPERA4/IMA Ion Energy table

Parameter.Name: VEX ASPERA4/IMA Elevation
Parameter.Description: VEX ASPERA4/IMA elevation table

Parameter.Name: VEX ASPERA4/IMA Particles counts
Parameter.Description: VEX ASPERA4/IMA Particles (counts/accumulation) counted in the current azimuth, mass, energy and polar angle sector.
